product.title: AME 3
product.description: Auto Media Embedder and Video Extender

plugin.title: AME - Display Don't Auto Convert Option

phrasetype.name: AME Admin
phrasetype.phrase: Path to cacheThis is the full server path to the folder used to store the cache. This folder needs to be server writeable. By default, the install location of this folder is {1} however it can also be held outside of your web root or renamed.
The path "{1}" does not appear to be a valid directory. Default location is {2}. File Caching has been disabled.
Cannot write to {1}. Check permissions on folder. File caching disabled until resolved.

Are you sure you want to permenantly delete {1}? This choice cannot be undone. Think hard before choosing yes. Think reallll hard.

no... harder than that.

ok. That's hard enough. Make your choice now wise one.
Do you really want to reset?
Choosing 'yes' will cause vBulletin to reset your video BBcode data back to the default. This will cause you to lose all imported, created or modified definitions. This cannot be undone.
Are you sure you want to replace your definitions with those from your last known save? Note that you can always revert back to system defaults via the Reset Definitions option in your tools menu.

This option can change old media tags back into URL tags so that you can then run the Rebuild tools to change those URLs into VIDEO codes. If upgrading from pre AME 3.x then you want to run this tool to revert old AME codes back to URL codes.

It is strongly advised that you back up your {1} table before running this tool as the changes made are permanent. I would also strongly advise running in test and verbose mode to check out the changes that would be made before actually making them. Finally, I would strongly advise you to check out the help topics (click the ? icons next to each setting) to fully understand the system.
Duplicate providers. Each provider MUST be unique! This is usually an indication that you are trying to import duplicate definitions. You really need to avoid this!
File cache<dfn>Choosing 'yes' will store much of the data AME needs as a file which may speed up processing</dfn>

This is the content of the imported file. Select which ones to import and make any changes you want before clicking the import button.

Note that you can only create new entries this way!

Upload an exported AME.xml file or enter the path to an already existing one. Note that you will then be presented with the items so that you can select which ones to import and to make any changes to the data that you want before the import takes place.
You cannot import this definition as there is already a definition that uses this items tagoption. Each definition (and tagoption) must be unique.
This is a duplicate of another definition in this file.
You cannot import this definition as its tagoption is invalid.
This definition is missing one or more required fields.
The file you imported does not appear to be a valid AME definition export.
How far back to go<dfn>This is how far back AME should look</dfn>
There are no items to import
Per Page<dfn>How many messages to process per page</dfn>
If using the file caching system, this option will force it to be resynced with the database.
Rebuild Completed. Click Here to return.
Runs AME on pre-existing text in your posts, blogs, group messages, visitor messages or signatures. Used to automatically auto VIDEO old posts and messages.
This option will reset your definitions back to the vBulletin default.

AME takes a snapshot of your definitions each time you save them or alter your settings just in case vB pulls a fast one and reverts them back to their defaults (i.e. after a vB upgrade). Use this option to revert to your last saved versions.
Seconds per page<dfn>The number of seconds to wait on a page before processing the next one.</dfn>
Some keys look freaky and contain invalid characters. Would not import them.
Some tagoptions entries are empty. This isn't a good sign. Wouldn't recommend importing them.
Test Mode<dfn>Process changes, but does not save them. Note that because no changes are made, you will always be on page 1 :)</dfn>
[AME] Upgrade<dfn>This process will convert all [AME] codes into [URL]s and then attempt to convert those to [VIDEO] codes. This is used to when upgrading from pre AME 3.x</dfn>
Verbose<dfn>Prints out before and after text as it is getting processed. Great to use in combintation with test mode to view potential changes</dfn>

phrasetype.name: Error Messages
phrasetype.phrase:
Can not save {1} because of the following error(s):
    {2}
You look to be trying to import an empty Definition file or a file that is not compatable with this version of AME.
You appear to be trying to import old AME definitions. You can only import definitions made in 3.x
You do not appear to have Blog installed.

I HAVE SAVED {1}.
Can I get an AMEN?

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Adjust only through the AME CP
Adjust this setting only through the AME CP
